mtd.mtext: This is a demo for the GtkMathView widget in order to present most of its features. In particular, we present some examples of rendering for each MathML presentation element, along with some more complete (and complex) examples of such elements inside mathematical furmulae. Feel free to send comments and/or contributions to the author at the following address:
This element represents a symbolic name or arbitrary text which sould be rendered as an identifier.

are examples of identifiers. Note that the style of the identifier depends on its length. In particular, the first two identifiers have length 1, so they are displated in italic, while the last one has a length greater the 1, so it is displayed in roman.
This element represents a `numeric literal' or other data which should be rendered as a numeric literal.

This element represents an operator or anything which should be rendered as an operator. There are several attributes for this element which are used to specify at a high level of detail the particular usage of a given operator. In particular, some operators are `stretchy', that is their extent (vertical or horizontal) change depending on the surrounding environment.

are examples of simple (non-stretchy) operators. It is important to note that special symbols such as fences are to be treated as operators. In this way they can be automatically stretched by the rendering engine. We can now try to render our first complex formula:
